I nominate the following methods of dealing with [Blightsteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightsteel Colossus) for special honors:  
  
MOST GAME-CHANGING: [Backlash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Backlash)/[Delirium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delirium)  
MOST AMUSING: [Kiku's Shadow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kiku's Shadow)  
MOST INSULTING: Block with [Storm Crow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Crow), survive at nine poison, then [Humble](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Humble) it to death

Posted By: SolidSoldier (2/2/2011 7:48:02 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'm a little sad that they made [Darksteel Colossus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Colossus) completely obsolete with this card's printing. I'm also disappointed at this card's sloppy artwork.
  
   
However, I'm happy to see Wizards finally print a fattie that can one-shot people AND can be cheated into play (Phage is too prohibitive). They were already flirting with the notion when they made the Eldrazi, but this isn't just 'you are crippled and will most likely lose' -- this is 'you are dead, now!'
posts.html:
I'm a little sad that they made Darksteel Colossus completely obsolete with this card's printing. I'm also disappointed at this card's sloppy artwork.

However, I'm happy to see Wizards finally print a fattie that can one-shot people AND can be cheated into play (Phage is too prohibitive). They were already flirting with the notion when they made the Eldrazi, but this isn't just 'you are crippled and will most likely lose' -- this is 'you are dead, now!'

posts.post_content:
Turn one: Island, zero cost artifact; exile [Simian Spirit Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simian Spirit Guide) from your hand to play [Need for Speed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Need for Speed); tap the island and exile two more spirit guides to [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker) out the Colossus; sac the island to Need for Speed, swing for the win.  
  
All you need is a perfect hand!

posts.post_content:
I don't get why people hate this thing so much.  
I understand and somewhat agree with the "powercreep" argument.  
However, this thing oozes flavor.  
Wizards took one of the most iconic cards from MIrrodin and turned it Phyrexian.  
If that doesn't scream out to my inner Vorthos, I just can't understand what will.
